issue.title: Semantic requirements of sized_range is circular

discussion.p:
p2.1 requires that for a sized_range t, ranges::size(t) is equal to ranges::distance(t). But for a sized_range, ranges::distance(t) is simply ranges::size(t) cast to the difference type.
Presumably what we meant is that distance(begin, end) — the actual distance you get from traversing the range — is equal to what ranges::size produces, and not merely that casting from the size type to difference type is value-preserving. Otherwise, sized_range would be more or less meaningless.
Set status to Tentatively Ready after seven votes in favour during reflector poll.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4885.

blockquote.pre: template<class T> concept sized_range = range<T> && requires(T& t) { ranges::size(t); };

blockquote.p: -2- Given an lvalue t of type remove_reference_t<T>, T models sized_range only if

li.p: (2.1) — ranges::size(t) is amortized 𝒪(1), does not modify t, and is equal to ranges::distance(ranges::begin(t), ranges::end(t)t), and
(2.2) — if iterator_t<T> models forward_iterator, ranges::size(t) is well-defined regardless of the evaluation of ranges::begin(t).
